description: UK businesses are seeking greater involvement in formulating trade policy, as the protectionism advocated by US President-elect Donald Trump plunges exporters into uncertainty.
title: UK Firms Call for Inclusion in Trade Talks Amid Tariff Threats

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Steven T. Dennis looks at Tulsi Gabbard’s meetings with senators. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Gabbard’s Past Statements About Assad Put Back in Spotlight

description: Republican Senator Joni Ernst, a key player in the struggle over Pete Hegseth’s confirmation as defense secretary, offered a boost on Monday to President-elect Donald Trump’s embattled nominee.
title: Key Republican Joni Ernst Gives Boost to Embattled Pete Hegseth Nomination

description: US lawmakers are moving to prohibit the Pentagon from doing business with companies that sell computer chips and services to Huawei Technologies Co. under defense legislation that could put further pressure on suppliers to the Chinese tech champion.
title: Huawei Suppliers to Face Further US Limits Under Defense Bill

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said Canada “will respond” if US President-elect Donald Trump imposes new tariffs on Canadian imports, and argued that retaliatory tariffs were successful when Trump put tariffs on Canadian steel and aluminum in 2018.
title: Trudeau Says Canada ‘Will Respond’ If Trump Imposes Tariffs

description: Chicago’s bid to become the Silicon Valley of the Midwest has registered some major wins in recent years: Google bought a huge downtown building, PsiQuantum Corp. announced a $1 billion investment in the city, and local startups raised a record $19 billion in 2022.
title: Cloud Computing Tax Threatens Chicago’s Silicon Valley Ambitions

description: Miami condo developer Jorge Perez said President-elect Donald Trump’s proposed mass deportations risk leading to a “police state” while also fueling new increases in consumer prices.
title: Billionaire Miami Developer Warns of ‘Police State’ From Trump Crackdown

description: Some 60 Gaza workers for World Central Kitchen, the Washington-based food relief charity that has tussled with the Israeli military for months, have lost their jobs, Palestinian media reported, after failing an Israeli background check.
title: World Central Kitchen Workers in Gaza Fail Israel Security Check

description: Bashar al-Assad’s fall from power in Syria could spark a fresh migration crisis across Europe, UK Foreign Secretary David Lammy warned, as Britain paused decisions on Syrian asylum claims.
title: UK Warns Assad Downfall Could Trigger European Migration Crisis

description: Ghana voted ex-President John Mahama to return to the role he served in eight years ago, handing him a strong mandate to fix the West African nation’s crippling debt burden and high cost of living.
title: Ghana’s Ex-President Gets Massive Mandate to Fix Inflation Woes

description: South Africa suspended operations at its main border crossing with Mozambique, a key coal and chrome export hub, as election-related protests flared in the southeast African nation.
title: Key South African Trade Route to Mozambique Shut as Protests Flare

description: UK Health Secretary Wes Streeting has been accused of “uncomradely behaviour” toward a former Cabinet colleague, in the latest case of tensions between Labour government factions spilling into the open.
title: UK Health Chief Faces Complaint Over Quip About Labour Colleague

description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul wants to send about $3 billion back to 8.6 million New Yorkers in a bid to alleviate inflation costs for working families.
title: NY’s Hochul Floats Sending $300 Checks to Millions of Residents

description: In the gut-wrenching footage in the aftermath of Bashar al-Assad’s fall in Syria, children, the elderly, women and men sprint toward the exit of the notorious Sednaya Prison on the outskirts of Damascus — some stand frozen in confusion at the news of their freedom.
title: Syrian Rescuers Dig to Free Prisoners From Torture Chambers

description: China’s escalating conflict with the US over trade is now extending to the drones that have become a vital part of Ukraine’s defense.
title: China Is Cutting Off Drone Supplies Critical to Ukraine War Effort

description: Canadians’ trust in Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to deal with incoming US President Donald Trump is growing, a new survey suggests.
title: Trudeau Now Tied With Conservative Leader on Who’s Trusted to Deal With Trump

description: Province of Buenos Aires Governor Axel Kicillof said he would try to block any federal government efforts to sell or shut down the loss-making national carrier, Aerolineas Argentinas SA.
title: Buenos Aires Governor Looks to Fight Milei Over Airline Sale

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said the UK would make a bigger push to deepen its economic ties with the European Union, as Keir Starmer’s new Labour government seeks a reset in relations with the bloc after the years of Conservative-led acrimony in the aftermath of Brexit.
title: Reeves Vows UK Will be ‘Ambitious’ in Deepening Ties With EU

description: The political chaos in France doesn’t mean the country’s budget should escape European Union scrutiny, according to Dutch Finance Minister Eelco Heinen.
title: France Deserves Same EU Budget Scrutiny as Netherlands, Heinen Says

description: Syria’s main airports suspended operations following the collapse of Bashar Al-Assad’s regime, halting the few remaining flights that had maintained a low level of international connectivity in the past decade.
title: Syria Loses Remaining Air Connections as Workers Abandon Airport

description: South Africa’s government won’t work with McKinsey & Co. on next year’s Group of 20 gatherings even after the global consulting firm agreed to pay more than $122 million to resolve criminal allegations tied to a corruption scandal in the country.
title: South Africa’s Government Won’t Work With McKinsey on 2025 G-20

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he raised the risk of a frozen conflict with Russia and pressed for security guarantees in talks with US President-elect Donald Trump and France’s Emmanuel Macron.
title: Zelenskiy Warns of Frozen Conflict Risk in Trump, Macron Meeting

description: The rebel group that toppled Syria’s President Bashar Al-Assad tasked Mohammed Al Bashir to form a transitional government, Syrian television reported.
title: Syria Rebel Group Political Chief to Form Temporary Government

description: Europe will need the US to project strength to halt more aggressive moves from Russia, the Czech Republic’s prime minister said, as he warned allies against “appeasement” in any process to end the war on Ukraine.
title: Europe Needs US to Project Strength to Putin, Czech Premier Says

description: Haiti’s death toll this year has hit startling levels after gangs ordered the revenge killing of at least 184 people over the weekend in the nation’s capital, a United Nations official said.
title: Voodoo Killings Add Nearly 200 to ‘Staggering’ Haiti Death Toll

description: Nippon Steel Corp. clarified its spending plans at US mills owned by United States Steel Corp. as part of last-ditch efforts to win over workers and politicians for its bid to buy the Pittsburgh-based steelmaker.
title: Nippon Steel Clarifies Spending Pledge in Effort to Save US Deal

description: The fall of Bashar al-Assad in Syria represents a personal defeat for Russian President Vladimir Putin and a potentially serious strategic setback for his military that undermines Moscow’s global ambitions.
title: Putin’s Syria Setback Threatens Key Russian Military Bases

description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang pledged Beijing will do everything possible to boost domestic consumption in an effort to support the country’s economic growth.
title: Chinese Premier Vows to Do Everything Possible to Expand Demand

description: Romania’s pro-European parties kicked off talks on Monday for a new government following the shock cancellation of a presidential vote whose first round was won by a fringe Russia-friendly candidate.
title: Romania Starts Talks on New Cabinet After Cancelled Vote

description: Austria’s government suspended all ongoing asylum requests from Syrian nationals and will prepare a plan for orderly repatriations of refugees following the fall of President Bashar al-Assad’s regime.
title: Austria Halts New Syria Asylum Requests, Plans Deportations

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez should seek a vote of confidence in parliament, according to one of the parties that supported his election as premier.
title: Spanish Premier Sanchez Should Seek Confidence Vote, Ally Says

description: A cache of internal Russian documents reviewed by Bloomberg reveals how Putin’s forces have been able to keep purchasing American semiconductors.
title: Russia’s Military Found a Surprisingly Simple Way to Buy US Chips

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Syrian Future Is Precarious After Assad Ouster

description: At a public event where billionaire Gautam Adani sat close to India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the Adani Group announced a plan to invest tens of billions of dollars, signaling that both its business ambitions and political goodwill were intact despite the founders’ legal woes in the US.
title: Gautam Adani Flanks Modi as Group Announces Big Investment Plans

description: France’s current political crisis isn’t a threat to Europe as a whole, Portuguese Finance Minister Joaquim Miranda Sarmento said.
title: Portugal’s Sarmento Says He’s Confident France Will Solve Crisis

description: The Bank of Japan is taking an unusual step that signals its efforts to improve communications, in a move that may increase market expectations for a rate hike next month.
title: BOJ Plans a Rare January Speech That May Lift Rate Hike Views

description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves travels to Brussels on Monday as part of a bid to build closer economic ties with the European Union, as the new Labour administration continues to push a “reset” with the bloc after years of division under the former Conservative government.
title: Reeves Visits Brussels to Push for Closer Economic Ties With EU

description: Turkish construction-related stocks, led by cement and steelmakers, surged as investors bet the companies will play a key role in the reconstruction of neighboring Syria after the rapid collapse of Bashar al-Assad’s regime.
title: Turkish Building Stocks Surge on Syria Reconstruction Bet

description: Israel struck chemical weapons and missile storage sites in Syria as a preventive measure, Foreign Minister Gideon Sa’ar said in a briefing on Monday.
title: Israel Says It Struck Chemical Weapons Storage in Syria

description: Switzerland is nearing publication of a landmark political inquiry into the causes of Credit Suisse’s 2023 downfall, a report which is likely to apportion blame for the crisis and set the tone for the future regulation of UBS Group AG.
title: Swiss Probe of Credit Suisse Nears With UBS Capital at Stake

description: Taiwan said China restricted airspace off its southeastern coast and sent naval vessels near the strait separating them, a sign Beijing may hold military drills in one of the world’s most tense geopolitical hotspots.
title: Taiwan on Alert as China Restricts Airspace in Potential Drills

description: China’s top leaders plan to loosen monetary policy and expand fiscal spending next year, as Beijing braces for a second trade war when Donald Trump takes office next month.
title: China Eases Monetary Policy Stance, Vows More Fiscal Support

description: Donald Trump said he had an exchange with Chinese leader Xi Jinping in recent days, the first clear indication of direct contact between the two men since the former US president’s reelection in November.
title: Trump Says for First Time He Communicated With Xi After Election

description: Squid Game auteur Hwang Dong-hyuk has joined calls by hundreds of Korean actors and directors to impeach or oust President Yoon Suk-yeol, pitting one of the country’s most powerful industries against the embattled leader.
title: ‘Squid Game’ Maker Joins Film Industry Call to Oust Korea Leader

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol survived an impeachment vote, but staying in office won’t protect him from investigations after his disastrous attempt to implement martial law. Prosecutors and police have opened probes into treason charges against him. The legal process could drag on for months or even years, and if he’s found guilty, he could face life in prison or — although unlikely — the death penalty. While South Korea has convicted former presidents of treason and impeached two other
title: What Future Does South Korea President Face After Treason Probe?

description: Meta Platforms Inc. allowed a network of Facebook pages to post more than 4,100 political ads attacking Romania’s pro-EU presidential candidate Elena Lasconi and promoting far-right figures, including Calin Georgescu, in the run-up to the country’s elections, a report showed.
title: Covert Facebook Network Found to Be Targeting Romanian Voters

description: The European Union’s multiyear clampdown on some of the largest American companies is set to force President-elect Donald Trump to decide which bothers him more: Europe or Big Tech.
title: Europe on Collision Course With Trump on Big Tech Crackdown

description: South Korean police said they are reviewing whether to impose an overseas travel ban on President Yoon Suk Yeol as they joined a race to investigate the embattled leader over his brief declaration of martial law.
title: South Korean Police Consider Overseas Travel Ban on Yoon

description: New Zealand’s government will pursue a capital injection of as much as NZ$500 million ($290 million) for state-owned Kiwibank as it seeks to improve competition in a banking sector dominated by four Australian-owned lenders.
title: New Zealand to Pursue Capital Injection for State-Owned Kiwibank

description: Australian law enforcement agencies have upgraded an apparent arson attack at a synagogue in the southern city of Melbourne to a “likely” terrorist incident, escalating the investigation of an event that prompted Israel’s prime minister to directly rebuke the government in Canberra.
title: Australia Synagogue Fire ‘Likely’ a Terrorist Attack, Police Say

description: Unions representing workers at some of South Korea’s largest companies have threatened to strike as they push for President Yoon Suk Yeol to resign after he narrowly avoided impeachment over the weekend.
title: South Korea Unions Threaten to Strike in Push to Remove Yoon

description: Australia has signed a treaty with the Pacific nation of Nauru which gives Canberra a veto over security and infrastructure partners, dealing another blow to China’s efforts to expand its strategic presence in the region.
title: Australia Inks Second Pacific Security Deal in Blow to China

description: President-elect Donald Trump announced that his personal lawyer Alina Habba will join his White House team and serve as counselor to the president.
title: Trump Taps Personal Lawyer Alina Habba as White House Counselor

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s government is set to launch a £100 million ($127 million) fund aimed at helping the state run “more like a start up,” as Labour attempts to rebut criticism over its tumultuous first few months in power.
title: Starmer Plans Reform of UK State in Bid to Counter Criticism
